content:
/>
V.iii.1.D.1.a
.
Historical Evaluation for Osteomyelitis
Both the 10-percent evaluation and that part of the 20-percent evaluation that is based on “other evidence of active infection within the last five years” are
historical evaluations, and
based on recurrent episodes of osteomyelitis.
Note
:  The 20-percent historical evaluation based on evidence of active infection within the past five years
must
be distinguished from the 20-percent evaluation authorized when there is a discharging sinus.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section D - Osteomyelitis
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section D
